prompt: 1. Governments should take ______ measures to ensure that the economic recovery is sustainable and inclusive for all sectors of society.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Ekonomik iyileşmenin sürdürülebilir olması için 'önemli/büyük' (substantial) önlemler gerekir.

prompt: 2. The scientist’s theory was initially met with skepticism, but subsequent experiments ______ his claims.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Başta şüpheyle yaklaşılmış ama sonraki deneyler iddialarını 'doğrulamış/geçerli kılmış' (validated).

prompt: 3. Due to the lack of funding, the construction of the new hospital has been ______ indefinitely.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Fon eksikliği yüzünden inşaat süresiz olarak 'askıya alınmış' (suspended).

prompt: 4. Children who grow up in a bilingual environment often develop greater cognitive ______ compared to monolingual children.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: İki dilli çocuklar daha fazla bilişsel 'esneklik' (flexibility) geliştirir.

prompt: 5. The manager decided to ______ the meeting until all the team members were present.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Herkes gelene kadar toplantıyı 'ertelemek' (put off) istedi.

prompt: 6. The detailed map ______ illustrated the ancient trade routes used by merchants centuries ago.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Harita yolları 'doğru/kesin bir şekilde' (accurately) gösteriyordu.

prompt: 7. If the archaeologists ______ the site sooner, many artifacts ______ stolen by looters.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Type 3 Conditional. Geçmişte koruma altına alınsaydı (had secured), çalınmazdı (wouldn't have been).

prompt: 8. The painting is believed ______ by a student of Leonardo da Vinci, rather than the master himself.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: 'Is believed' + 'to have V3' (Passive). Geçmişte yapıldığına inanılıyor.

prompt: 9. ______ the advance of technology, privacy concerns have become a major issue for internet users.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Teknolojinin ilerlemesiyle 'birlikte' (With the advance of...).

prompt: 10. Many diseases that were once fatal can now be treated ______ antibiotics.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Antibiyotik 'ile' (with) tedavi edilebilir.

prompt: 11. The study focused ______ the effects of sleep deprivation ______ cognitive performance.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Odaklanmak 'focus ON'. Bir şeyin başka şey üzerindeki etkisi 'effect ON'.

prompt: 12. ______ cars are convenient, they contribute significantly to air pollution.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Rahat olmalarına 'rağmen' (Although), kirliliğe neden olurlar.

prompt: 13. It is important that specific regulations ______ to protect endangered species.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Subjunctive (Passive). 'It is important that... be V3'.

prompt: 14. No sooner had the meeting started ______ the fire alarm went off.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: 'No sooner... than' yapısı. Başlar başlamaz alarm çaldı.

prompt: 15. The city is famous ______ its historical architecture, which attracts tourists ______ all over the world.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Bir şeyle ünlü olmak 'famous FOR'. Dünyanın her yerinden 'FROM all over'.

prompt: 16. ______ the heavy traffic, we managed to arrive at the airport on time.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Yoğun trafiğe 'rağmen' (Despite + Noun Phrase).

prompt: 17. CLOZE TEST: Astronomy is the study of celestial objects. It is one of the oldest sciences, (17) ______ back to ancient civilizations. Early astronomers used simple tools to observe the stars.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: 'Dating back to' (kökeni ...'ya dayanan) kalıbı. Active participle.

prompt: 18. (18) ______ the invention of the telescope in the 17th century, astronomy underwent a revolution.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Teleskobun icadıyla 'birlikte' (With), devrim geçirdi.

prompt: 19. This invention allowed scientists (19) ______ planets and stars in much greater detail.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: 'Allow someone TO do something'. Gözlemlemelerine izin verdi.

prompt: 20. Today, powerful telescopes, some of (20) ______ are located in space, continue to expand our knowledge.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Cansız varlıklar için miktar belirten ifadelerden sonra 'of which' kullanılır.

prompt: 21. We are now able to see galaxies that are billions of light-years (21) ______.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Mesafe belirtirken 'light-years AWAY' (ışık yılı uzakta) denir.

prompt: 22. CLOZE TEST 2: Plastics are synthetic materials made from polymers. They are durable and lightweight, (22) ______ makes them useful for many applications.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Kendinden önceki cümlenin tamamını niteleyen 'which' yapısı.

prompt: 23. However, their durability also means they (23) ______ in the environment for hundreds of years.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Dayanıklı oldukları için doğada yüzlerce yıl 'kalırlar/varlıklarını sürdürürler' (persist).

prompt: 24. Plastic pollution has become a global crisis, (24) ______ marine life and ecosystems.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Virgül + Ving (Active Participle). 'Tehdit ederek' (threatening).

prompt: 25. (25) ______ recycling efforts, millions of tons of plastic still end up in landfills.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Geri dönüşüm çabalarına 'rağmen' (Despite), çöplüklere gidiyor.

prompt: 26. Scientists are now looking (26) ______ biodegradable alternatives to replace traditional plastics.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Alternatifler 'arıyorlar' (looking FOR).

prompt: 27. ______ , he still managed to finish the marathon in under four hours.
A: Although he was injured halfway through
C: Because he is a professional runner
D: As long as he kept running
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Zıtlık. Yaralanmasına 'rağmen' (Although), bitirmeyi başardı.

prompt: 28. Because the demand for electric cars is increasing, ______.
A: car manufacturers are investing more in battery technology
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Talep arttığı 'için' (Because), üreticiler pil teknolojisine yatırım yapıyor.

prompt: 29. Unless we reduce our carbon footprint immediately, ______.
A: global warming will reach irreversible levels
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Azaltmazsak (Unless), küresel ısınma geri dönülemez olacak.

prompt: 30. While some people prefer working from home, ______.
A: others find the office environment more productive
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Bazıları evden sever 'iken' (While), diğerleri ofisi tercih eder.

prompt: 31. Given the complexity of the problem, ______.
A: it will take a long time to find a solution
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Karmaşıklığı 'göz önüne alındığında' (Given), çözmek zaman alacaktır.

prompt: 32. Just as a conductor leads an orchestra, ______.
A: a CEO directs the operations of a company
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: 'Just as... so...' benzetmesi. Şef orkestrayı nasıl yönetirse, CEO da şirketi yönetir.

prompt: 33. Even though she had a high fever, ______.
A: she insisted on going to work
B: she stayed in bed all day
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Ateşi olmasına 'rağmen' (Even though), işe gitmekte ısrar etti.

prompt: 34. Since the museum was closed for renovations, ______.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Kapalı olduğu 'için' (Since), sergiyi göremedik.

prompt: 35. However expensive the hotel was, ______.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Ne kadar pahalı olursa olsun (However expensive), her kuruşuna değdi.

prompt: 36. In order to improve your English, ______.
A: you should practice speaking every day
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Geliştirmek 'için' (In order to), pratik yapmalısın.

prompt: 37. The Industrial Revolution marked a major turning point in history, shifting production from hand tools to machines.
A: Sanayi Devrimi, üretimi el aletlerinden makinelere kaydırarak tarihte büyük bir dönüm noktası oldu.
B: Tarihte büyük bir dönüm noktası olan Sanayi Devrimi ile üretim el aletlerinden makinelere geçti.
C: El aletlerinden makinelere geçiş, Sanayi Devrimi ile tarihte önemli bir yer tutar.
D: Üretim el aletlerinden makinelere kayınca Sanayi Devrimi tarihte bir dönüm noktası yarattı.
E: Sanayi Devrimi tarihin en büyük dönüm noktasıdır çünkü üretim makinelere kaymıştır.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: 'marked a turning point' (dönüm noktası oldu), 'shifting' (kaydırarak). A şıkkı.

prompt: 38. Artificial intelligence is expected to transform many industries, from healthcare to finance, in the coming decades.
A: Yapay zekanın önümüzdeki on yıllarda sağlık hizmetlerinden finansa kadar birçok sektörü dönüştürmesi bekleniyor.
B: Gelecek on yıllarda sağlık ve finans gibi sektörler yapay zeka tarafından dönüştürülecektir.
C: Yapay zeka, sağlık ve finans dahil birçok sektörü dönüştürmeyi beklemektedir.
D: Sağlık hizmetlerinden finansa kadar birçok sektörün yapay zeka ile dönüşmesi bekleniyor.
E: Önümüzdeki yıllarda yapay zeka sağlık ve finans sektörlerini değiştirecektir.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: 'is expected to transform' (dönüştürmesi bekleniyor). A şıkkı tam çeviri.

prompt: 39. Despite the availability of advanced medical treatments, many people in developing countries still lack access to basic healthcare.
A: Gelişmiş tıbbi tedavilerin varlığına rağmen, gelişmekte olan ülkelerdeki birçok insan hala temel sağlık hizmetlerine erişimden yoksundur.
B: Gelişmekte olan ülkelerde temel sağlık hizmeti yoktur, oysa gelişmiş tedaviler mevcuttur.
C: Tıbbi tedaviler gelişmiş olsa da, gelişmekte olan ülkelerdeki insanlar sağlık hizmeti alamıyor.
D: Gelişmiş tıbbi tedaviler mevcut olduğu halde, birçok insan temel sağlık hizmetine ulaşamıyor.
E: Temel sağlık hizmetlerine erişimden yoksun olan insanlar, gelişmiş tedavilerden de yararlanamaz.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: 'Despite the availability' (Varlığına rağmen), 'lack access' (erişimden yoksundur). A şıkkı.

prompt: 40. Eğitim, sadece bilgi edinmek değil, aynı zamanda eleştirel düşünme becerilerini geliştirmektir.
A: Education is not only about acquiring knowledge but also about developing critical thinking skills.
B: Education means acquiring knowledge and developing critical thinking skills.
C: Developing critical thinking skills is as important as acquiring knowledge in education.
D: Not only knowledge but also critical thinking is important in education.
E: Education acquires knowledge and develops critical thinking.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: 'Sadece ... değil, aynı zamanda ...' (not only ... but also). A şıkkı.

prompt: 41. Küresel ısınmayı durdurmak için hükümetlerin acil ve kararlı adımlar atması gerekmektedir.
A: Governments need to take urgent and decisive steps to stop global warming.
B: To stop global warming, governments must take steps immediately.
C: Urgent steps should be taken by governments to stop global warming.
D: Global warming can be stopped if governments take decisive steps.
E: Governments are taking urgent steps to stop global warming.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: 'Acil ve kararlı adımlar' (urgent and decisive steps), 'atması gerekmektedir' (need to take). A şıkkı.

prompt: 42. Bilim insanları, Mars'ta bir zamanlar suyun sıvı halde bulunduğuna dair kanıtlar buldular.
A: Scientists have found evidence that water once existed in liquid form on Mars.
B: Evidence found by scientists shows that water was liquid on Mars.
C: Scientists found that liquid water existed on Mars once.
D: There is evidence that water existed on Mars, according to scientists.
E: Water in liquid form was found on Mars by scientists.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: 'dair kanıtlar buldular' (found evidence that), 'sıvı halde' (in liquid form). A şıkkı.

prompt:
43. READING PASSAGE 1: The Vikings were seafaring people from Scandinavia who raided, traded, and settled in wide areas of Europe from the late 8th to the mid-11th century. Often depicted as brutal barbarians, they were also skilled craftsmen, sailors, and traders. Their longships were technologically advanced for their time, allowing them to travel across open oceans and up shallow rivers. The Vikings established settlements in places as far apart as Iceland, Greenland, and North America, centuries before Columbus.

According to the passage, the Vikings ______.
A: were not just raiders but also skilled traders and craftsmen
C: were primitive people with no technology
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Sadece barbar değillerdi, aynı zamanda 'yetenekli zanaatkarlar ve tüccarlardı'.

prompt: 44. The Viking longships were unique because ______.
A: they allowed travel across oceans and shallow rivers
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Gemileri hem 'okyanuslarda' hem de 'sığ nehirlerde' gidebiliyordu.

prompt: 45. The passage mentions that Vikings settled in ______.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: İzlanda, Grönland ve Kuzey Amerika'da yerleşim kurdular.

prompt: 46. It is implied that the Vikings arrived in North America ______.
C: with the help of the Romans
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Kolomb'dan 'yüzyıllar önce' (centuries before) oradaydılar.

prompt:
47. READING PASSAGE 2: Coral reefs are diverse underwater ecosystems held together by calcium carbonate structures secreted by corals. Coral reefs are built by colonies of tiny animals found in marine waters that contain few nutrients. Most coral reefs are built from stony corals, which in turn consist of polyps that cluster in groups. They are often called 'rainforests of the sea' because they form some of Earth's most diverse ecosystems. They occupy less than 0.1% of the world's ocean area, yet they provide a home for at least 25% of all marine species.

Coral reefs are compared to rainforests because ______.
A: they support a vast diversity of life
C: they receive a lot of rain
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: 'Rainforests of the sea' denir çünkü 'en çeşitli ekosistemleri' barındırırlar.

prompt: 48. Coral reefs are built by ______.
A: colonies of tiny animals called polyps
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: 'Polip' adı verilen küçük hayvan kolonileri tarafından inşa edilirler.

prompt: 49. Despite covering a small area of the ocean, coral reefs ______.
A: host a quarter of marine species
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Okyanusun %0.1'ini kaplarlar ama türlerin %25'ine ev sahipliği yaparlar.

prompt: 50. Corals are found in marine waters that ______.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: 'Besin açısından fakir' (contain few nutrients) sularda bulunurlar.

prompt:
51. READING PASSAGE 3: Marie Curie was a Polish and naturalized-French physicist and chemist who conducted pioneering research on radioactivity. She was the first woman to win a Nobel Prize, the first person and the only woman to win the Nobel Prize twice, and the only person to win the Nobel Prize in two different scientific fields. Her achievements included the development of the theory of radioactivity, techniques for isolating radioactive isotopes, and the discovery of two elements, polonium and radium.

Marie Curie is famous for ______.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Radyoaktivite üzerine öncü araştırmalarıyla tanınır.

prompt: 52. According to the passage, she was the first woman to ______.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Nobel Ödülü kazanan 'ilk kadındır'.

prompt: 53. Marie Curie discovered ______.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: İki elementi keşfetmiştir: Polonyum ve Radyum.

prompt: 54. What makes her Nobel Prize wins unique?
A: She won in two different scientific fields
C: She shared them with her husband
D: She won them in the same year
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: İki 'farklı bilim dalında' (Fizik ve Kimya) kazanan tek kişidir.

prompt:
55. READING PASSAGE 4: The Great Depression was a severe worldwide economic depression that took place mostly during the 1930s, beginning in the United States. The timing of the Great Depression varied across nations; in most countries, it started in 1929 and lasted until the late 1930s. It was the longest, deepest, and most widespread depression of the 20th century. The depression originated in the United States, after a major fall in stock prices that began around September 4, 1929, and became worldwide news with the stock market crash of October 29, 1929, known as Black Tuesday.

The Great Depression began in ______.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: ABD'de başladığı (beginning in the United States) belirtiliyor.

prompt: 56. The depression was triggered by ______.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Hisse senedi fiyatlarındaki düşüş (fall in stock prices / crash) ile tetiklendi.

prompt: 57. The Great Depression lasted until ______.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: 1930'ların sonuna kadar (until the late 1930s) sürdü.

prompt: 58. Black Tuesday refers to ______.
A: the stock market crash of October 29, 1929
D: the start of World War II
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: 29 Ekim 1929'daki borsa çöküşüne 'Kara Salı' denir.

prompt:
59. READING PASSAGE 5: Photography is the art, application, and practice of creating durable images by recording light, either electronically by means of an image sensor, or chemically by means of a light-sensitive material such as photographic film. It is employed in many fields of science, manufacturing (e.g., photolithography), and business, as well as its more direct uses for art, film and video production, recreational purposes, hobby, and mass communication.

Photography involves creating images by ______.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Işığı kaydederek (recording light) görüntü oluşturma sanatıdır.

prompt: 60. Images can be recorded ______.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Hem elektronik (sensör) hem de kimyasal (film) yolla kaydedilebilir.

prompt: 61. Photography is used in fields such as ______.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Bilim, üretim ve iş dünyasında kullanılır.

prompt: 62. One direct use of photography mentioned is ______.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Sanat, film ve video üretimi doğrudan kullanımlarıdır.

prompt:
63. Alice: I'm thinking of adopting a pet.
Bob: ______
Alice: I live in a small apartment, so maybe a cat would be better.
Bob: Yes, cats are generally lower maintenance than dogs.
A: What kind of pet are you considering?
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Alice 'Belki kedi daha iyi olur' diyor. Bob 'Ne tür düşünüyorsun?' diye sormuştur.

prompt:
64. Patient: My back has been hurting for weeks.
Doctor: ______
Patient: I lifted some heavy boxes while moving house.
Doctor: It sounds like a muscle strain.
A: Did you do anything strenuous recently?
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Hasta ağır kutu kaldırdığını söylüyor. Doktor 'Yorucu bir şey yaptın mı?' diye sormuştur.

prompt:
65. Student: Can I hand in my essay next week?
Professor: ______
Student: I have been ill for the past few days.
Professor: In that case, bring a doctor's note and I'll accept it.
A: Why do you need an extension?
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Öğrenci mazeretini (hastaydım) açıklıyor. Profesör 'Neden ek süre istiyorsun?' diye sormuştur.

prompt:
66. Interviewer: Why did you leave your last job?
Candidate: ______
Interviewer: That's understandable. We offer plenty of opportunities for advancement here.
A: I felt there was no room for growth.
D: It was too far from home.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Görüşmeci 'Burada yükselme fırsatı çok' dediğine göre, aday 'Gelişim imkanı yoktu' (no room for growth) demiştir.

prompt:
67. Tourist: Is it safe to walk around here at night?
Local: ______
Tourist: Thanks for the warning. I'll take a taxi then.
A: It's better to avoid side streets.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Turist 'O zaman taksi tutayım' diyor. Yerli 'Ara sokaklardan kaçınsan iyi olur' (uyarı) demiştir.

prompt: 68. It is unnecessary for you to bring food as we will provide lunch.
A: You don't need to bring food because lunch will be provided.
B: You must bring your own food.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: 'Unnecessary' (gereksiz) = 'don't need to'. A şıkkı.

prompt: 69. She regrets not studying harder for the exam.
A: She wishes she had studied harder for the exam.
B: She is happy with her exam results.
D: She doesn't care about the exam.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: 'Regrets not studying' (Çalışmadığına pişman) = 'Wishes she had studied' (Keşke çalışsaydım).

prompt: 70. I would rather stay home than go to the party.
A: I prefer staying home to going to the party.
B: I want to go to the party.
E: I am going to the party.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: 'Would rather' = 'Prefer'. Tercih cümlesi.

prompt: 71. The heavy rain prevented us from going on a picnic.
A: We couldn't go on a picnic because of the heavy rain.
B: We went on a picnic despite the rain.
C: The rain was light, so we went out.
D: We didn't want to go on a picnic.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: 'Prevented' (engelledi) = 'Couldn't go' (gidemedik).

prompt: 72. Forests are vital for the environment. ______ . They also provide habitat for countless species.
A: They absorb carbon dioxide and produce oxygen.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Ormanların faydaları sıralanıyor. CO2 emerler ve oksijen üretirler.

prompt: 73. Many people want to lose weight. ______ . However, crash diets are often unhealthy and ineffective.
A: They often try various diets to achieve this.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Kilo vermek isterler, 'bu yüzden diyet denerler' (try diets). Sonraki cümlede bu diyetlerin zararı anlatılıyor.

prompt: 74. Learning to play an instrument takes time. ______ . Consistent practice is key to mastery.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Zaman alır, 'sabır ve adanmışlık gerektirir' (requires patience).

prompt: 75. The internet has changed the world. ______ . We can access information instantly.
A: It has made information more accessible.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Dünyayı değiştirdi, 'bilgiyi erişilebilir kıldı' (made accessible).

prompt: 76. (I) Penguins are flightless birds. (II) They live almost exclusively in the Southern Hemisphere. (III) Eagles can fly very high. (IV) Their wings have evolved into flippers for swimming. (V) They feed on krill and fish.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Parça penguenlerle ilgili. III. cümle kartallardan (Eagles) bahsediyor.

prompt: 77. (I) Chocolate is made from cacao beans. (II) It is a popular treat worldwide. (III) Vanilla is a flavor derived from orchids. (IV) The beans are roasted and ground to make cocoa mass. (V) Sugar and milk are often added to create chocolate bars.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Parça çikolata yapımı ile ilgili. III. cümle vanilyadan bahsediyor.

prompt: 78. (I) The pyramids of Egypt are ancient masonry structures. (II) Most were built as tombs for the country's pharaohs. (III) The Nile River is the longest river in the world. (IV) The Great Pyramid of Giza is the oldest of the Seven Wonders. (V) They were constructed using limestone.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Parça piramitlerle ilgili. III. cümle Nil Nehri'nden bahsediyor.

prompt: 79. (I) Tennis is a racket sport. (II) It can be played individually or in pairs. (III) Football is the most popular sport in the world. (IV) The game involves hitting a ball over a net. (V) Points are awarded when the opponent fails to return the ball.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Parça tenis ile ilgili. III. cümle futboldan bahsediyor.

prompt: 80. (I) Sleep apnea is a serious sleep disorder. (II) It occurs when a person's breathing is interrupted during sleep. (III) Dreams can be very vivid. (IV) People with untreated sleep apnea stop breathing repeatedly. (V) This can lead to loud snoring and daytime tiredness.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Parça uyku apnesi hastalığı ile ilgili. III. cümle rüyalardan bahsediyor.
